com.panviva.util.pgc.helper

Class CommandLineHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.panviva.util.pgc.helper.CommandLineHelper

  • public class CommandLineHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This helper class processes all the command line arguments. It provides the following: 1. Command line argument validation 2. Command line argument usage reporting allowing the user to see what the command line options are and their meaning.
    Author:
    jcharles

      • isUseNestedTableIndenting

        public boolean isUseNestedTableIndenting()
        Get a boolean flag indicating if the nested table content is to be indented or not in the target format. SupportPoint does not currently support nested tables so content need to be compacted into a single table depth. Indentation is used to discriminate nested content. 1 indent for 1 level of nesting, 2 indents for 2 level of nesting etc.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setUseNestedTableIndenting

        public void setUseNestedTableIndenting(boolean useNestedTableIndenting)
        Set a boolean flag indicating if the nested table content is to be indented or not in the target format.
        Parameters:
        useNestedTableIndenting - - boolean

      • getWildcard

        public java.lang.String getWildcard()
        Get the document wildcard. Default is "*.docx". This is expanded to all documents in the current target folder and all descending folders.
        Returns:
        String - Document wildcard ie. "*.docx"

      • getDocTypeFromWildcard

        Returns:
        SupportedDocType - Valid command types are: ".docx", ".pptx", ".xslx", ".xhtml", ".xml", ".pdf"

        Returns:
        String - The final stage XSLT transformation file

        Private convenience method to test if a supplied string can be interpreted as a boolean.

        defaultValue - - Default value assigned if not set
        Returns:

      • getNewWildcard

        public static java.lang.String getNewWildcard(java.lang.String wc)
        This method processes the wildcard specified on the command line. If a wildcard is specified on the commandline any * characters must be prefixed with a '\' character. i.e. -w "\*.docx" Otherwise it will be expanded at the time the getOptionValue is issued. This will then retrieve a list of docx files in the workspace directory or sub-directories of the current user.
        Parameters:
        wc - - Wild card value
        Returns:
        wildcard - New wild card value

      • getSpsTreeXsl

        public java.lang.String getSpsTreeXsl()
        Get the path to the SupportPoint XSLT file used to derive the folder and document relationship tree structure. This is used for the final stage transformation of input documents to theie SupportPoint specific importable xml format file counterpart. If not specified this defaults to {current working directory}/resources/sps-tree.v1.0.xsl
        Returns:
        String - The Final stage SupportPoint XSLT transform file used to generate an output folder treeFinal stage SupportPoint XSLT transform file used to generate an output folder tree

      • setSpsTreeXsl

        public void setSpsTreeXsl(java.lang.String spsTreeXsl)
        Set the path to the SupportPoint XSLT file used to derive the folder and document relationship tree structure. This is used for the final stage transformation of input documents to theie SupportPoint specific importable xml format file counterpart. If not specified this defaults to {current working directory}/resources/sps-tree.v1.0.xsl
        Parameters:
        spsTreeXsl - - Set the

      • getLog4jProps

        Parameters:

      • getThreadCount

        public int getThreadCount()
        Return the number of simultaneous threads used to convert input document. 8 threads means 8 simultaneous document conversions. Default is 4.
        Returns:
        int - The number of simultaneous file conversion threads to execute.

      • setThreadCount

        public void setThreadCount(int threadCount)
        Set the number of simultaneous threads used to convert input document. 8 threads means 8 simultaneous document conversions. The default is 4.
        Parameters:
        threadCount - - Sets the number of simultaneous file conversion threads to execute.
